c74object.name: bach.clip
c74object.digest: Limit elements of lllls within a certain range
c74object.description: Constraints each element of the incoming llll into a given numerical range, defined by a lower and an upper boundary.

objarg.name: lower_boundary
objarg.description: The optional first argument sets the initial lower boundary. If the boundary needs to be an llll (see llll message), such llll needs to be wrapped in an outer level of parenthesis.

objarg.name: upper_boundary
objarg.description: The optional first argument sets the initial upper boundary. If the boundary needs to be an llll (see llll message), such llll needs to be wrapped in an outer level of parenthesis.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs and outputs the calculation on the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Clip lll, output result, set boundary
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is taken as the llll to be clipped. Each element of such llll is constrained to lie inside the range defined by the lower and upper boundaries: if it is smaller than the lower boundary it is set to be the lower boundary, if it is bigger than the upper boundary it is set to be the upper boundary. The modified llll is then output through the outlet.
An llll in the second inlet sets the lower boundary, an llll in the third inlet sets the upper boundary. In case such lllls are plain numbers, the meaning is trivial: such numbers apply for all elements of the original llll, coming from the first inlet. In case any of the two lllls is a complex llll, it is assumed to be an element-wise boundary for the incoming llll, exactly as it happens for the inputs of bach.maximum and bach.minimum. If any boundary llll is complex, and do not correspond in length with the original llll, the longer is always considered (and exceeding elements are trivially preserved). If single scalar elements are in the same position of complex lllls, such scalars apply for all elements of the corresponding llll.

method.name: number
method.description: A number in the second inlet sets the lower boundary for each element of the llll. A number in the third inlet sets the upper boundary for each element of the llll.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: Lower and upper boundaries must be coherent, namely the upper one must always be greater or equal to the smaller one (also element-wise, if any of them is a complex llll), otherwise the result might be inconsistent.
